intro: Arctotis bellidifolia var. incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and vibrant blue or purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from spring to autumn.
